bug.short_desc: Problems with target schema builder

long_desc.thetext:
Sheldon,
There are a few problems with the TargetSchemaBuilder: 1) The data structure is not namespace aware (you're storing localname, and target constraint in a map)
2) The substitution elements are not handled properly. It's not going to work if the referenced substitutedGroup element is loaded after the element containing the substitutedGroup attribute.
This is an older bug that I haven't investigated yet. Ali, as far as you know, is this still a problem?
I believe (1) was addressed but I can't recall if (2) is still an issue.
Do you have a use case or recreation scenario? The description doesn't have enough info for me to know where to start.
Ali, do you have an XML snippet that illustrates the issue described in #2?
Ali, do you have an SML snippet that illustrates the issue described in #2?
Let's get this defect at of the way. I'm closing it as invalid since I'm not clear what my original comments imply

bug.short_desc: M7_T4- Service Flows Registry- Error message provide an incorrect URL template

long_desc.thetext:
1. Go to "Service Flows Registry" 2. Click the "New Service" button 3. In the resulting dialog enter "simple" in each field and click the "OK" button 4. Notice the error message states- "ServiceURL must be of the format http://server/...serviceflowname?operation
This URL template is incorrect because the server port number must be included

The interpretation of the URL is now handled in a different way. The URL is now checked for its activeness (ie) Checks if the URL is pingable and correspondingly informs the user on the validity of the service and confirms from the user if they still want to go ahead with the service (URL).
Please evaluate for inclusion in 1.0M7T5
Fix is in T5
An error message appears stating the service is unavailable and if you still want to use it. Guess this better solves the problem.

bug.short_desc: Enumeration options in properties views should be disabled when working on a simple type list

long_desc.thetext: When working on a simple type "list", the controls in the properties views for enumerations allow the user to input data, resulting in an invalid XSD file. These controls should be disabled/invisible according to the variety of the simple type.
Fix checked in for WTP 3.0 M3.

bug.short_desc: M7_T4- Event Mapping- the text of the event mapping delete confirmation dialog should be changed

long_desc.thetext: 1. Go to "ALF Event Mapping" 2. Click the "Delete" button 3. Notice the text of the confirmation dialog "Are you to want to delete the event-action" 4. In this text, "event map" should be used instead of "event-action"

This error message seems to be valid since we are actually trying to delete a relation that has been established between Event and Action. When we try to delete a row here you are actually trying to break (or) delete the mapping that has been established between A Event and Action.
The Title for this group has been modified now as "Event-Action Map".
Please evaluate for inclusion in 1.0M7T5
Fis is in T5
As of T5 the phrase "event-action" is used not "Event-Action Map". Which of the two is correct?
Tim can you comment on this?

Event-Action should be hyphenated where ever it appears. This designer creates Event-Action maps. Event-Action Mapping is an acceptable title for the section for now. Just need to add the hyphen
The current "delete" warning message which states: "Are you sure you want to delete the event-action?" is fine although "Are you sure?" would probably be sufficient in this case.
This has been fixed. The message/title has been changed accordingly.

bug.short_desc: Use of template config.ini in launcher dos not seem to work correctly

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
It does not appear that the selection of a template config.ini file works correctly in he PDE launcher. If you select a template config.ini file, I would expect PDE to do something like this:
All entries in this template file should be added to the generated configuration file used to launch the platform If the osgi.framework setting is not specified in the template file, it should be added with the full path for the org.eclipse.osgi plugin. The location will also be resolved so that if it is in the workspace, the workspace version will be referenced. The osgi.splashPath should be fixed to support relative paths (see Eclipse bug https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=140173 for some history). If these entries are not present, they should also be added: osgi.configuration.cascaded=false osgi.install.area=file\:<install_dir>\\eclipse\\ (based on the target platform setting of couse) All existing PDE processing in this file should probably remain in place (i.e. resolving the osgi.bundles entries).
I only tried this on 3.2.1, but Brian assures me that this has not been fixed in 3.3 yet.
More information:
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 161265 ***

bug.short_desc: Loading of extension points from platform should be configurable

long_desc.thetext: Currently the PDE only seems to load a hard coded list of extension points from the target platform. Since other tools may want to look at the extension points that the target platform is providing, it would be nice if the list that was loaded could be easily (programmatically or declaratively) extended. That way if I wanted to have the PDE load 2 more extension points I could add those to the list PDE loads and retrieve the details using existing methods.
Are we going to see this in 3.3? Did the alternative registry idea get implemented making this unnecessary?
This needs to get into 3.4.
Once we finish the extension registry work, you won't need to configure anything. All the extensions/extension points from the target will be available.
Configurable, ha! PDE is now capable of reading/store extension/extension point information for all the plug-ins in the target platform and workspace. Will be available in 3.4M2 and later.
It does not seem to be working in Eclipse 3.2.2. Just kidding. Thanks Brian.

bug.short_desc: Status information is not cleared after a local log import using a rules parser has finished

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: TPTP-4.2.0
Steps To Reproduce: 1.Import an Apache access log file using a rules parser. 2. Select the imported log file in the log navigator, notice that a status message showing information related to the processing of events is displayed. The message is confusing since it appears according to it, that the log import hasn't finished. See attached screen shot. 3.
More information:

Created an attachment (id=56596) Screen shot capturing the problem
Status message not being cleared marked with a red rectangle.
I think this one is for you Marius to investigate.
This needs to be fixed in 4.4.
I think we looked at this problem and was triggered by the fact that cleanup was not called when the import was finished, I'll look into it again.
Yes please, and if the cleanup solves the problem then Cindy would need to do it in her code.
Could not be contained in i1, deferring to i2.
Could not be contained in i2, deferring to i3.

Assigning this to Rohit to investigate. The problem is likely with the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.internal.adapter.formatters.LocalLogImportCBEFormatter Formatter that is used during local log import. The necessary cleanup is likely not being done. Please work with Marius and Cindy to investigate and resolve this.

Rohit cannot reproduce this problem with TPTP 4.4. I also could not reproduce it with TPTP 4.3.1 and TPTP 4.4. It appears this problem only occurs with the 4.2.x stream. I confirmed with Alex and Marius that changes introduced in TPTP 4.3 for providing a log import service and refactoring the log import code to separate the UI from the service code resulted in the event processing data not being displayed in the UI any longer.
I will close this bugzilla as WORKSFORME. If consuming products want this fixed in the 4.2.x stream, they can open a new bugzilla.

bug.short_desc: M7_T4- Event Mapping- Attempting to resume a running ALF Application results in a report java exception

long_desc.thetext: 1. Go to "ALF Event Mapping" 2. Have a running ALF Application 3. Attempt to resume the ALF Application by clicking the "Resume" button 4. In the results dialog, click the "OK" button 5. Notice console reports a java exception- org.eclipse.alf.exception.InvalidApplicationNameException: "TestALFConfig1" application is already running
Console message are now removed ,as the Messagebox provides meaningful informations.
Please evaluate for inclusion in 1.0M7T5
Fix is in T5
There is no console message.

bug.short_desc: Build log missing summary for Export->Deployable Plugins

long_desc.thetext:
Build N1220
Export->Deployable Plugins produces log files with warning errors.
They seem to be structed with each entry starting with:
---------- 1. WARNING in D:\eclipse blah blah
and at the end they have a summary like:
---------- 2 problems (2 warnings)
However, one log file I got had neither of these information pieces, it simply looked like:
# 1/8/07 3:30:12 PM EST # Eclipse Java Compiler 0.728, 3.3.0 milestone-5, Copyright IBM Corp 2000, 2006. All rights reserved. File D:\eclipse workspaces\ArpEggDevel\JMusic\src\instruments\SawtoothInst.java is specified more than once
See also bug #169742.
Those logs are generated by the JDT Compiler and pde build does not influence them. Moving to JDT.
Closing as INVALID. When the command line is wrong, the compilation doesn't start and this means that the log doesn't have the same format. Using an xml log would be more helpful.

bug.short_desc: M7_T4- Event Mapping- Text of "Get Application Status" can be improved

long_desc.thetext: 1. Go to "ALF Event Mapping" 2. Have a running ALF Application 3. Click the "Get Application Status" button 4. Notice the console report 5. The text "ApplicationName" can be improved to "Application Name" 6. The text "Timestamp" can be improved to "Time stamp"
Console print has been modified to display "ApplicationName" as "Application Name" and "Timestamp" as "Time stamp"
Please evaluate for inclusion in 1.0M7T5
Fix is in T5

My mistake-
Can you change "Time stamp" to "Time Stamp"?
"Time stamp" chnaged to "Time Stamp"

bug.short_desc: Build log has error which is not present in IDE, for Export->Deployable Plugins

long_desc.thetext:
Build N1220
I received the following error in a log when doing an Export->Deployable Plugins.
# 1/8/07 3:30:12 PM EST # Eclipse Java Compiler 0.728, 3.3.0 milestone-5, Copyright IBM Corp 2000, 2006. All rights reserved. File D:\eclipse workspaces\ArpEggDevel\JMusic\src\instruments\ SawtoothInst.java is specified more than once
There are two problems: 1) I don't understand what the message is trying to tell me 2) There is no corresponding error marker in the IDE (but there should be, I assume)
See also bug #169742 and bug #169911.

Closing as INVALID. The batch compiler invoked in the export had twice the same file on the command line. This was due to a problem in the build.properties file. Two source folders were overlapping. From the compiler point of view, this was the right error.

bug.short_desc: Dialogs Misshapen in Update Manager

long_desc.thetext: The license acceptance dialog comes up horizontally narrow, but vertically, taking up the whole screen.
I think this has been fixed in a more recent builds. Have you tried 3.3M6 or newer?
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991

bug.short_desc: Unreachable code status cannot be changed

long_desc.thetext: Although help says we can change the severity status of "unreachable code" (ignore, warning, error), this option does not appear on the proper configuration window. The severity if error and cannot be changed.
Where did you see that in the doc ?

Java Development User Guid -> Reference -> Tips and tricks.
Actually it says tha "java compiler detects unreachable code", but doesnt say that you can change it. So, this bug is INVALID.

bug.short_desc: make strikethrough font optional

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060629-1905
Steps To Reproduce: Try to read the title text of one of your complete tasks in the "Task List".
More information: It make sense to have it light grey and striked during normal circumstances; however when trying to copy the context from a completed task, this is a real nuisance and significantly increases the time required to find the correct task. It would be great if the text of completed tasks would change back to black on white with no strike though while the user has their mouse over it.
Currently I often find myself changing the tasks back to Incomplete just so I can read it.
P.S. Love Mylar, great work!
One for you Mik...
Gerry: could you please attach a screenshot of this? I find completed tasks easy enough to read, but this probably has to do with my screen font.

I also think that striketrough is hard to read in both Task List and the Search views.
Mik, can you please make it configurable trough Appearance / Colors and Fonts. So, it would be possible to change color and font style (i.e. disable striketrough).

I'm not sure that I can make it optional via themes, because we have to create this font in code, but this may be possible, or we can create a custom preference. Also, it would still be helpful for me to see a screenshot so that I get a sense of the problematic font, since we are using it as default.

Created an attachment (id=57277) striketrough look
Mik, you can probably create a dummy font in appearance preferences and then copy its styles to the programmatically created font.
Anyways, here is the screenshot of striketrough in Task List and Search views.

Sorry Mik, haven't checked back on this in a while. I'll get you a screenshot when I get into work in the morning.
However I think by it's very nature it is supposed to be hard to read so they don't take away focus from the pending tasks. Any text which is light grey on a white background and striked-though is going to be harder to read than plain black text on white.
Now that I think of it, what would be even better than my original suggestion would be a toggle button to turn the completed task dulling on and off.

Gerry, you've convinced me that a large part of our problem is the fact that the strikethrough font is too light. I took a look at the Outlook 2003 and 2007 UI and their strikeghtough fonts look identical, except that they're darker. So what I've done for now is to make the default color darker, and also added this color to our theme settings so that it can be configured by the user.
The reason that I'm shying away from making this a preference is that creating preferences often means that the root problem gets neglected (e.g. font was too light). However, I'm going to leave this open in case anyone still finds the font unreadable to the point that they want to disable it. A note of caution though: I worked with Mylar for at least a year before it had the strikethrough, and it makes the problem was that it takes a lot more effort to identify which tasks are completed and which aren't, even though we have the icon overlay.
Mik, I still would prefer to be able to disable striketrough. Sorry, but it just too many horizontal lines. It would be fine if you could striketrough just a bug id, but text should be readable.

Created an attachment (id=58076) Very hard to read text
See attachment for my screenshot.
I'm not sure how well Eugene's idea would work in practice, it could be a good part solution to the problem, but there would still need to be some sort of dulling of the text so that it doesn't overwhelm the user, so the toggle button would still be needed for when you have to read though closed bugs.
Eugene: if you can give me a snippet for making the strikethrough go through just the ID I could try that. For local tasks it would probably have to go through the whole task though.

Strike my previous comment. I am now much more interested to get rid of those striketroughs, especially on search results.
Besides, I don't think tree widget allows to decorate part of text label without getting into custom drawing.

The strikethrough is a very visible thing but this bug report has been the only case where this has been brought up. So I'm not yet sure if it is worth adding an option for this. The tooltips help, but I do realize that in the Search view (or another part of the UI that could be geared towards showing completed stuff) the current thing is suboptimal. But for the Task List my understanding of user feedback is that it is still best.
Eugene: you could consider adding preference to the Sandbox for this. I think I'll create another Sandbox feature called "Experimental UI" or "UI Tweaks" where this kind of stuff makes sense to try out.

(In reply to comment #12) > But for the Task List my understanding of user feedback is that it is still best.
That is not what I read from Gerry's comments. I may live with striketrough showing on tasks with guaranteed visibility, but when using quickfind it is rather interfering then useful.
> Eugene: you could consider adding preference to the Sandbox for this. I think > I'll create another Sandbox feature called "Experimental UI" or "UI Tweaks" > where this kind of stuff makes sense to try out.
That would be better then nothing.
BTW, the suggested setting should be in General / Appearance / Colors and Fonts, but the code still have to be in the task.ui. So, I am not sure if it does make sense for sandbox here.

Java and text editors cannot be opened, giving the same error. Ditto for the About dialog. The install log page shows "success" for all features being enabled and disabled.

The exception looks similar to bug 145988, but I'm not sure why this would only manifest itself in 3.2.1 and not 3.2.
Rolling back the configuration to 3.2 did not help, but what did was disabling one of the local plugins which had worked perfectly fine until this update.

I found a workaround that allows me to continue using the said internal plugin: in Eclipse's plugins directory, I noticed I had ICU jars for two versions, 3.4.4.1 and 3.4.5, where the latter was installed as part of my 3.2.1 update. I tried temporarily removing 3.4.5 jar, but then Eclipse wouldn't even start with errors in the log that it is missing the ICU bundle. I then made a copy of 3.4.4.1 jar and named it com.ibm.icu_3.4.5.jar, and now everything works fine, and I don't have to disable any plugins. I've no idea why this helped, or how long it will work, though.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 145988 ***

DJ, I don't think this is a duplicate of bug 145988. It seems like we can't have 2 versions of ICU4J present in the plugins directory. Keep in mind, plugins using ICU4J are asked to use the Import-Package directive instead of Require-Bundle, maybe this is part of the problem?

I am unable to reproduce this problem. My steps:
- install Eclipse 3.2 - create Java project, package and java file - in the Packages Explorer set the filters to show "." resources - make the Error Log visable and fill it with contents (copied log from other workspace) (I opened this view because it uses ICU) - Help -> Software Updates -> Find and Install... -> Search for updates... -> Eclipse 3.2.1 - restart when requested
My Eclipse restarts ok.
Then I also created a 3.2.2 update site based on the contents of the latest 3.2.2 maintenance stream build. I updated the workspace to these new feature versions and everything works ok.
I am doing all of this with JDK 1.5.0_06.
As for the multiple versions, ICU specifies the "singleton" directive in its manifest file so we can have multiple versions on the file-system but only one will be installed. When people do "import-package" and don't specify a version, they will get whichever one was installed.
You can check which version you have installed by: 1) Help -> About -> Plug-in Details 2) or running with java.exe, and using the -console command-line arg and typing "ss". (note you may have to run also with -noexit so the console doesn't go away when Eclipse dies)
Closing. Please re-open if you have a reproducible test case for us. Thanks.

Karice, this is a duplicate of 145988, DJ's setup is missing one crucial step: there has to be a third-party plugin which references the ICU4J. (Actually, ours carries an older copy of ICU with it.) As I said in the other bug, the workaround was to disable this plugin or get rid of one version of ICU4J.

bug.short_desc: Need migration strategy for new settings configuration

long_desc.thetext:
Ironically, I am suffering from the results of my own request for new way to save AJDT project settings. I still believe that it was the right thing to do in the long run, but since we can't expect everybody to jump into Eclipse 3.3 at the same time there should be a migration strategy. So, team members who are using Eclipse 3.2 and 3.3 can work on same AJDT-enabled projects. Unfortunately, right now, AJDT automatically converts settings into a new format and that break the project for other team members, because these files are usually under version control.
I can think of two possible options to resolve this. Have a global, or per-project option that would turn on the old way to save settings; or never convert settings automatically and add a conversion action (like PDE Tools / Migrate to 3.0...).

I considered the migration options when implementing the feature but didn't have a good solution for backwards compatibility. When I first moved the project builder from the ui to the core plugin I put in a dialog to ask the user whether they wished to keep the reference to the old builder in order to preserve compatibility with older AJDT versions. But I think in this case allowing for both ways of setting aspectpath and inpath would be confusing and the likely source of future bugs. And not converting the settings automatically would mean that migration wouldn't happen in most cases as people often wouldn't know they needed to do that, so we'd be stuck with the old mechanism.
Therefore I suggest the best way to handle this would be to use .cvsignore so that people on 3.3 don't commit the deleted .setting files. It would just mean that changes to the aspectpath or inpath should be made on 3.2 so that they will be picked up on 3.3. But I don't imagine those settings are changed that often, so it shouldn't be a big deal. What do you think?

I don't think .cvsignore is a good option, because it will require to manage this file locally. Maybe it is better to check if .settings file is present and update it together with .classpath when configuration changes and also propagate changes from .settings to .classpath if new changes detected (i.e. when they come from version control). Then for old project we will keep users of new and old AJDT in sync, and new projects will always use .classpath

Keeping both settings in sync is not an option because then there is no migration, and we have to support both mechanisms forever more. Given that aspectpath and inpath settings are not likely to change very often and the existence of manual workarounds to the problem, I'm closing this as won't fix.

Matt, can you at least change AJDT to not delete old settings file when converting to new settings? That would solve my issue, because excluding the old settings file from the version control is not an option for me. Thanks.

(In reply to comment #4) > Matt, can you at least change AJDT to not delete old settings file when > converting to new settings? That would solve my issue, because excluding the > old settings file from the version control is not an option for me. Thanks.
If we don't delete the old setting, then as above there is no migration. We then have the overhead of always reading the old settings and writing the new settings, and never being able to remove the old mechanism.

(In reply to comment #5) > If we don't delete the old setting, then as above there is no migration. We then > have the overhead of always reading the old settings and writing the new > settings, and never being able to remove the old mechanism.
Ok. Let me ask this. Does attribute-based approach supported in AJDT for Eclipse 3.2?
If not, then we'll need to keep old settings until Europa release.

(In reply to comment #6) > Ok. Let me ask this. Does attribute-based approach supported in AJDT for > Eclipse 3.2?
No, AJDT for 3.2 will ignore such classpath attributes. Also I believe it would not be possible to backport the functionality because some fixes were required in Eclipse 3.3 in order for us to switch to using classpath attributes.

(In reply to comment #7) > No, AJDT for 3.2 will ignore such classpath attributes. Also I believe it would > not be possible to backport the functionality because some fixes were required > in Eclipse 3.3 in order for us to switch to using classpath attributes.
Actually you could backport it, but because 3.2 erase attributes on saving .classpath it will be loosing configuration. That is another reason to don't delete old .settings file until Eclipse 3.3 release. Maybe you can compare timestaps between .classpath and the old settings file...

bug.short_desc: org.eclipse.uml2-Plugin should set JDT preferences to use 1.4 compilation environment

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: I20061102-1715
Steps To Reproduce: To ensure no compilation problems arise due to the fact that EMF has moved to using generics, the old API plugin org.eclipse.uml2 should have an org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs file specifying something like the following:
#Tue Jan 09 08:58:51 CET 2007 eclipse.preferences.version=1 org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.codegen.inlineJsrBytecode=enabled org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.codegen.targetPlatform=1.2 org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.codegen.unusedLocal=preserve org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.compliance=1.4 org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.debug.lineNumber=generate org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.debug.localVariable=generate org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.debug.sourceFile=generate org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.assertIdentifier=warning org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.enumIdentifier=warning org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.source=1.3
More information: If you have specified compatibility of 5.0 as the global preferences in your Eclipse, checking out the old API (which I just need because I am doing feature-based building and the old API is still included in the uml2 feature - could one not remove it from there?) causes compilations problems, because its compatibility is not set to 1.4 explicitly.

Note that both the org.eclipse.uml2 and org.eclipse.uml2-plugin projects in CVS share the same plug-in identifier, 'org.eclipse.uml2'; this is the identifier being referenced by the feature. To get around this problem, please ensure that only one of these two projects is checked out in your workspace at a given time. More specifically, the list of projects that should be checked out in your workspace (from HEAD) is:
org.eclipse.uml2-feature org.eclipse.uml2-plugin org.eclipse.uml2.codegen.ecore org.eclipse.uml2.codegen.ecore.ui org.eclipse.uml2.common org.eclipse.uml2.common.edit org.eclipse.uml2.doc-feature org.eclipse.uml2.doc-plugin org.eclipse.uml2.examples-feature org.eclipse.uml2.examples-plugin org.eclipse.uml2.examples.uml.ui org.eclipse.uml2.sdk-feature org.eclipse.uml2.tests-feature org.eclipse.uml2.tests-plugin org.eclipse.uml2.uml org.eclipse.uml2.uml.ecore.exporter org.eclipse.uml2.uml.ecore.importer org.eclipse.uml2.uml.edit org.eclipse.uml2.uml.editor org.eclipse.uml2.uml.resources org.eclipse.uml2.uml.tests

bug.short_desc: Crash when no project types are defined

long_desc.thetext: If I try to create a new managed build project when no project types are defined, I get NPE. This does not happens with stock CDT, but could happen with a customized one. The problem is that ManagedBuildManager.getDefinedProjectTypes does not check for null list of projects everywhere. Patch is attached.
Created an attachment (id=56616) The fix

bug.short_desc: WPDD is missing if an user defined diagram is assigned

long_desc.thetext:
WPDD is missing while assign an user defined diagram to replace the WPDD, no such problem for AD/ADD.
Steps: 1. Create a CP, Activity and WPD like this: -CP -Activity -WPD 2. Create a Support Material, input something in Main Description 3. Set UDD for activity (right click on activity->Diagrams->UDD) on WPU tag 4. Check the "Use WPDD for browsing and publishing" and click "Select" 5. Select the Support Material and click "OK" 6. Save all and switch to Browse perspective --> Problem: Click the activity, switch to WPU tag, bothe the WPDD and the UDD are missing
Two questions: 1. step 2 -- create a supporting Material -- seems not to have any impact on all other stpes. What is the intended purpose for this step? 2.

Answer for Q1: Tools support use User Define Diagram to replace a existed WPDD (or AD and ADD), the UDD can be designed by a Support Meterial (in main description). I create a new one for step 4 and 5, I can select it as the UDD for WPDD.
Resolved.
Fix is verified on EPF 1.2 20070612-1544. Closed.

bug.short_desc: Negative top and left values for birt:viewer are ignored.[0002][0603]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Negative top and left values for birt:viewer are ignored.
Build number:2.2.0.v200701091110
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a BIRT web project. 2. New a jsp file based on birt template. 3. Input content as below: <birt:viewer id="1" reportDesign="birt_tag_sample.rptdesign" position="absolute" top="-30" left="-30"> </birt:viewer> 4. Preview the jsp file.
Expected result: Negative values are exported to html souce and display the report at the specified position.
Actual result: Negative values were abandoned.
Error log:N/A
Support negative value for top and left attributes.
Verify in build 2.2.0.v20070111

bug.short_desc: Fraction Digits can not be remembered [0001]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Fraction Digits can not be remembered.
Build number: 2.2.0.v20070109-1110 eclipse: 3.3, JDK: 1.5
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a chart with category series type number. 2. Choose Format Chart tab, Chart Area->Axis->X-Axis->Format Specifier, set Prefix a, Suffix b, Multiplier 10 and Fraction Digits 0, click finish and save. 3. Reopen chart builder and open Format Specifier.
Expected result: Fraction Digits can be remembered.
Actual result: Fraction Digits is always 2.
Error log: N/A
Already fixed in local PC, and available to check in as soon as the recovery of network, so change the priority from P2 to P4.

Save the value before notification, also fixed in Advanced (Number): Pattern.
Due to the network connection problem, currently the fix is only available in local CVS.
Verified in build (200701171001), closed.

bug.short_desc: Stack overflow in Jobs API

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Run the attached project as Eclipse application. 2. Hit the menu entry JobManagerLoad. 3. In the console, a stack overflow error is reported.
More information: From the location where the error is thrown, I would conclude that the exclusion of jobs, which must not be performed in parallel (aka which are excluded via an appropriate rule) are somehow recursively scheduled for execution. If the number of jobs is more than the number of allowed stack traces, the error occurs.
Note that this has been discovered by a bug in the debug view decoration in Eclipse 3.2.0. The decoration had been defined as mutual exclusive job for each element in the debug view which led to the problem described. The respective coding has been changed with 3.2.1, but the underlying problem in the Jobs API still exists. From the coding I conclude a simple tail recursion which should be solvable with a while loop.
Created an attachment (id=56618) A Plugin project to reproduce the problem

I can reproduce this, but I'm having a hard time finding the cause because I can't see the problematic stack (Bug 170558). Do you know some trick to get it to show the stack trace for the thread with the stack overflow?

(In reply to comment #2) > I can reproduce this, but I'm having a hard time finding the cause because I > can't see the problematic stack (Bug 170558). Do you know some trick to get it > to show the stack trace for the thread with the stack overflow?
I am getting a stacktrace in the console view when starting a runtime workbench and hitting the menu entry. If that doesn't work for you try starting with -debug -consolelog. The design time as well as the runtime was started with -Xmx512m as jvm parameter.
Another way is to start the workbench in debug mode and to set an Exception breakpoint on StackOverFlowError, which shows the entire stack when stopping.
I should have posted the stacktrace nevertheless. Sorry for that. It is:
java.lang.StackOverflowError at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.InternalJob.addLast(InternalJob.java:116) ....
or the bottom frames from the debugger: SampleAction$1(InternalJob).addLast(InternalJob) line: 116 JobManager.nextJob() line: 827 JobManager.startJob() line: 1102 WorkerPool.startJob(Worker) line: 206 Worker.run() line: 51
Kindest Regards Richard

Created an attachment (id=57553) Fix
Switched tail recursion to iterative solution
Thanks, fix released.

attachment.desc: A Plugin project to reproduce the problem

bug.short_desc: Some patters cannot work for datetime and float in birt:param.[0603][0705]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Some patters cannot work for datetime and float in birt:param.
Build number:2.2.0.v200701091110
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a jsp file based on birt template. 2. Input content as below: <birt:report id="2" reportDesign="param7.rptdesign" height="500" width="500"> <birt:param name="p5_f" value="$23,145.789456" pattern="$#,000.00"/> <birt:param name="p6_dt" value="2006/09/23 10" pattern="yyyy/MM/dd hh"/> </birt:report> 3. Preview the jsp file.
Expected result: Accept the value with predefined pattern.
Actual result: Error message to say the values are invalid.
Error log:N/A
Created an attachment (id=56620) report design
The default of isLocale attribute is false. If set Pattern in tag, set isLocale as true.
Verify in build 2.2.0.v20070111

bug.short_desc: [regression]1/0 are treated different when set in birt:param tag.[0603][0705]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: 1/0 are treated different when set in birt:param tag. No errors for 1 but errors for 0.
Build number:2.2.0.v200701091110
Steps to reproduce: Prepare a report with a boolean parameter. 1. New a jsp file based on birt template. 2. Input content as below: <birt:report id="4" reportDesign="param8.rptdesign" height="500" width="500"> <birt:param name="p1_b" value="0"/> </birt:report> <birt:viewer id="2" reportDesign="param8.rptdesign" height="500" width="500"> <birt:param name="p1_b" value="1"/> </birt:viewer> 3. Preview the jsp file.
Expected result: Errors for both report.
Actual result: Error message for value 0 but no error message for value 1.
Error log: org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.metadata.ValidationValueException: The value "0" is invalid with the type "boolean". at org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.util.ParameterValidationUtil.doValidateBoolean(ParameterValidationUtil.java:556) at org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.util.ParameterValidationUtil.validate(ParameterValidationUtil.java:127) at org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.util.ParameterValidationUtil.validate(ParameterValidationUtil.java:368) at org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.util.ParameterValidationUtil.validate(ParameterValidationUtil.java:514) at org.eclipse.birt.report.utility.DataUtil.validate(Unknown Source)
Actual result: "1"/"0" aren't treated.
Close it.

bug.short_desc: [preferences] Reopening preference dialog does not select page if nesting level >= 3

long_desc.thetext:
3.3 M4
1. add your own preference page to Java > Editor > Content Assist 2. start target in the target: 3. Window > Preferences... 4. edit some preferences on the second child page of Java > Editor > Content Assist 5. click OK 6. Window > Preferences... ==> first instead of second child page of Java > Editor > Content Assist is selected
This was my bug: I used the same id.
*** Bug 173091 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds >= I20070207-0800.
Verified in I20070207-0800.

bug.short_desc: [EditorMgmt] Should not show dialog when closing workbench window with dirty editor opened in another window

long_desc.thetext:
N20070104-0010.
New work has been put in place to allow users not to show a Save dialog when closing an editor if another editor still edits the same data.
If the user decided to do so, then closing a workbench window should also honor this setting. If the user did not yet set this setting then the Save dialog with the checkbox should appear.

bug.short_desc: [regression]JS errors when submit a blank value to report by birt:requester.[0603][0705]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: JS errors when submit a blank value to report by birt:requester
Build number:2.2.0.v200701091110
Steps to reproduce: Prepare a report with a datetime report parameter. 1. New a jsp file based on birt template. 2. Input content as : <birt:requester id="param_request_1" name="request1" isCustom="true" reportDesign="requester2_dt.rptdesign" locale="fr_fr"> p1_datetime: <input type="text" name="p1_datetime"/> <input type="submit" name="OK" value="submit"/> </birt:requester> 3. Preview the jsp file. 4. Input nothing and click "submit" button.
Expected result: Error from birt about blank datetime value.
Actual result: JS errors: Can't move focus to the control because it is invisible...
Error log:N/A
It is an issue about check if missing parameter. For this case, it should pop up the parameter dialog.
Verify in build 2.2.0.v20070111

If I right click on such a project and select PDE Tools -> Organize Manifest... I cannot continue because pressing the Finish button has no effect. An investigation of the log file showed that an error was logged.

Hi Gunnar,
I successfully reproduced the problem you encountered using 3.3 M4.
I am unable to reproduce the problem you encountered using I20070110-1600. So I believe that Chris' fix for Bug # 168181 also solves your problem.
Please try it out and reopen this bug if you still see a problem.

bug.short_desc: [call hierarchy] Call Hierarchy view shows error dialog on refactoring method

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1.Open a call hierarchy on a method.
2.Refactor that method sig (say, add a param to that method)
3.Double click on the method (whose sig has now been changed) in the 'Call Hierarchy' view.
4.Error dialog box pops up
More information:

bug.short_desc: Check for Get application Status; not giving any information when the Even Action Map is empty.

long_desc.thetext: Create an EventActionMap Now the event action map is empty Check for "Get application Status" button. It is not providing any information

This issue has been fixed, to check if the EventACtion Map is empty to get the ApplicationStatus. We get the Status of the Application using the application name, we we are not able to get the application name from the .alf file we throw error message.
Please evaluate for inclusion in 1.0M7T5
Fix is in T5
Verified in T5 and closed
Verified in T5 and closed

bug.short_desc: Set meaningful eclipse.buildId on runtime instances

long_desc.thetext:
3.3 M4
eclipse.buildId is usually set in config.ini. When launching an Eclipse application (runtime instance) this build id is not set.
I already had the case where a developer rejected a bug report because of this 'unknown' build id. Although the runtime instance was based on a clean Eclipse milestone build.
Maybe it could be set to something like "runtime (base on I....)" in the generated config.ini.

will be covered bug 141918 since buildId is one of the keys in the config.ini that will be carried over.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 141918 ***

bug.short_desc: [Edit] Compare editor does not take focus

long_desc.thetext:
I20061219-1300
The asynchronous compare editor does not take focus any more when it is opened. The Editor tab looks active, but the focus stays where it was before.
Steps: - select two files in Package Explorer - context menu > Compare With > Each Other => selection stays in Package Explorer tree, but Editor tab is rendered as active (try again if shell activation bug 166483 occurs)
I get the same behavior in 3.2 so it does not appear to be due to changes in 3.3.

I've released a fix so that the Compare Editor now gets focus. However, the TextMergeViewer does seem to give focus to a particular pane (even though setFocus is called on the pane). I'll need to dig deeper to see what's happening.
Fix released to HEAD
Verified using I20070206-0010

bug.short_desc: [content assist][api] provide better access to ContentAssistant

long_desc.thetext:
Hi, I am a committer for the PDT project. As a Java developer, I always missed the automatic content assist triggered by any character, and not only by the '.' or any other configurable list of characters. for example, if the user types the following: class MyClass extends | (the "|" is the carret position) in other words if the user put a space after the word "extend" a list of classes to override will automatically pop up.
Lately, we received several similar requests from the PDT users about the content assist. This can only emphasise the need for this feature.
I saw that in bug #101420 someone asked for a similar feature, but I guess my request is simpler. I'm willing to implement it myself as a patch if you will approve it as a necessary feature (and assuming you are not working on something like this currently).
Thanks, Guy
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 159157 ***

Our suggestions are different, he asks to expend the triggers range, and I think we need to extend the mechanism and give the processors the option to be activated regardless to the user typing. I also think we should integrate the solution inside org.eclipse.jface.text.contentassist.ContentAssistant and not as an external plugin.

>Our suggestions are different I know it's a little bit different but it goes into the same direction and thought this might be enough for you. There are no plans to put a general trigger mechanism into content assist as this would affect typing performance considerably. Feel free to subclass content assistant and provide this feature in your editor.
>I also think we should integrate the solution inside >org.eclipse.jface.text.contentassist.ContentAssistant >and not as an external plugin. Sure. That's why the other bug is still open.

The problem is that I can't access some important data members like fContentAssistSubjectControlAdapter for instance since they are private (and its Type ContentAssistSubjectControlAdapter is package).
Any chance you could change some of those members and types in order to make it more available for subclassing. (I'll send the full list of members and types I need if you agree).
Access to fContentAssistSubjectControlAdapter could be granted but not to the class. fContentAssistSubjectControlAdapter could be be access via type 'IContentAssistSubjectControl'.

Here is the list of things I need access for: 1. running the following functions fProposalPopup->isActive() fProposalPopup->showProposals(boolean)
fContextInfoPopup->isActive() fContextInfoPopup->showContextProposals(boolean)
prepareToShowCompletions() promoteKeyListener()
2. option to set fLastAutoActivation
3. We want to override manageAutoActivation() for that we need access for: fContentAssistSubjectControlAdapter - we need access for the member according to IContentAssistSubjectControl interface fAutoAssistListener - only getter and setter will do.
please reconsider
I assume you would write your own subclass of the ContentAssist then, right?
yes
I suggest you attach a patch (as small as possible) here that adds protected methods to ContantAssistant and fits your needs. I can then review.

Created an attachment (id=71837) patch allowing subclassing and replacing the AutoAssistListener
What I did is added an option to replace the AutoAssistListener and question the ContentAssistant regarding fContextInfoPopup and fProposalPopup state.
Of course we can extend the support for subclassing even more, I would be glad to debate we you about it if you like.
Thanks.
The attachment is not a valid patch. You need to load the 'org.eclipse.jface.text' project from CVS, modify the file(s) and then create the patch.

Created an attachment (id=71882) patch allowing subclassing and replacing the AutoAssistListener
hope it's ok now...

>Of course we can extend the support for subclassing even more, I would be glad >to debate we you about it if you like. I want to keep it to a minimum unless we have a clear use case. The last 6 years went quite well the way it's currently implemented ;-)
Now to your patch: I can accept something along those lines. Here are the detail comments:
- since there's already a public setAutoActivationDelay I would simply add a corresponding getter as public API. This makes the story consistent.
- isProposalPopupActivated ==> isProposalPopupActive
- the 'not' in isContextInfoPopupNotActivated is ugly. I would change the name to isContextInfoPopupActive and adjust the logic.
- the new methods need Javadoc and you need to put your name into the header comment along these lines below the initial contributor: full name, e-mail - bugNr bugSummary

Created an attachment (id=71995) patch with fixes
I changed the patch as you requested. One point though
> - the 'not' in isContextInfoPopupNotActivated is ugly. I would change the name > to isContextInfoPopupActive and adjust the logic.
the method functionality was: (fContextInfoPopup != null && !fContextInfoPopup.isActive()) (like in line 312 in the original file). changing the name to a "positive" one, will get us to: (fContextInfoPopup == null || fContextInfoPopup.isActive()) which means it will return that the fContextInfoPopup is active although the fContextInfoPopup is null.
That's why I had to split this method into two, isContextInfoPopupInitiated and isContextInfoPopupActive.

I don't see why you would need isContextInfoPopupInitiated(). The field is not null as soon as content assist is installed.
Please add full Javadoc as in all other methods of the class and don't forget to add the @since 3.4 tag.

> I don't see why you would need isContextInfoPopupInitiated(). The field is not > null as soon as content assist is installed.
The same reason you do in line 312.

Created an attachment (id=72023) update documentation
hope its OK now
Do you only need the new is* methods in your AutoAssistListener subclass?

and the getAutoActivationDelay(). As I said I tried to keep it as minimal as possible.
But I guess if we wanted to make it even more accessible for subclassing than we could also open the CompletionProposalPopup and ContextInformationPopup for the public.
I don't like the two isContext* methods. I suggest we add protected getContextInfoPopup() and getContextInfoPopup() to the AutoAssistListener. This way you can do with them whatever you like.
But then we'll have to open ContextInformationPopup and CompletionProposalPopup for the public. is that ok with you?

I've thought about this again and there is really no need to have isContextInfoPopupInitiated().
I've applied your patch - isContextInfoPopupInitiated() + small modifications inside ContentAssistant to use the new is* methods + cosmetics (formatting, wording of Javadoc)
Thank you very much, it was pleasure working with you.

attachment.desc: patch allowing subclassing and replacing the AutoAssistListener
patch allowing subclassing and replacing the AutoAssistListener

bug.short_desc: License agreement scales wizard to full screen height

3.3 M4
I've installed a new feature from my site for testing purposed. During the installation I noticed that the wizard page where a user has to accept the license forces a resizes of the wizard dialog to take the full screen height. This looks weird.
IMHO the page should not force a resize of the wizard dialog at all. The license panel already has scrollbars so a user can scroll the license agreement.
This is a dup of bug#168306.

bug.short_desc: Exclusion filter for source folders unclear

long_desc.thetext:
The documentation (help/ntopic/org.eclipse.jdt.doc.user/reference/ref-123.htm) say:
Exclusion filter: Selects which resources are not visible to the compiler
From this, I'd expect that if I added "*", then either nothing would be compiled or none of the non-java files would be copied to the bin directory.
Neither seems to be true. So what is this option for?

Created an attachment (id=56623) report content - viewer

When viewer calls RunAndRenderTask to generate report content, the report title should be passed into it. The title can be from: 1) Defined in report design file 2) URL parameter using &__title= 3) Default value defined in viewer
Pass Embedded Setting null value as default value.

org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui.internal.editor.InternalXSDMultiPageEditor.openOnGlobalReference(InternalXSDMultiPageEditor.java:407) [etc.]

Rich, I was able to reproduce the bug. It seems to have something to do with jumping between XSD components defined in different inline schemas in the WSDL document. The problem code seems to be in org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui.internal.utils.OpenOnSelectionHelper#revealObject line 101
if (component.getRootContainer().equals(xsdSchema))
In this example's case the target component's root container is in another schema, different than the one used to open the inline schema editor. The XSD editor is normally not aware of the schema boundaries being crossed and because the test condition is never met the code goes into an infinite loop.
I'm CC-ing Keith as well since you'll probably have to work together on fixing this.

bug.short_desc: [DataBinding] Provide examples of masking for Text

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: I20070102
Steps To Reproduce: When passing null as the BindSpec before the API change and renames, you used to get a PartialValidator for simple types (Double, Integer etc) for free.
Now you don't. Instead you get a validator that returns STATUS.OK no matter what. You can see this in DefaultBindSpec, line 382.
As this is (IMO) by far the commonest case when using forms to edit objects (ie. don't allow user to enter invalid value), I would like that back, please :)
It makes no sense to allow text in a text box that binds to a number, and the user won't find out until they press OK. Since the plumbing for assigning validators already exists, and works, I wonder why this functionality was removed.
More information:

This is how I bind my stuff:
dbc.bindValue(SWTObservables.observeText(bodyWeight, SWT.Modify),BeansObservables.observeValue(measurement, "bodyWeight"), null);

I would also like to propose, if this is going to be fixed, to take into account the issues about i18n and l10n. In the previous implementation, regexps where used, as far as I remember. This provided a basic functionality, but it was too simple: my users are Greek (so am I) and we use different delimiters for the thousands and decimals:
10.000.00,32 instead of 10,000,00.32
I just told them to use the English way, and they didn't mind (much). But I always felt that this should be fixed.

I removed the partial validator implementations exactly for that reason (l10n). I'm from Germany where numbers are written the Greek (or Arab?) way too.
Brad - the Eclipse way would be to use ICU4J's DecimalFormat, are you OK with adding a dependency on ICU4J for this? See http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/ICU4J.
I'm not Brad, but I'm a committer so I'll +1 on this. :)

Since DecimalFormat is a part of the replacement plug-in I'm in.
+ 1

Sorry I probably wasn't fully awake when I looked at this. The problem is how do we get something like a regexp, or even a list of valid characters for a data type like float in a way that works with i10n? Does anybody know more about DecimalFormat.toLocalizedPattern() and if it could be used for this purpose?

I don't know about DecimalFormat, but the naive way for doing this would be trying to use Float.parseFloat(string) that AFAIK uses the current Locale to do it's thing, and catch any NumberFormatExceptions that arise...

(In reply to comment #7) > I don't know about DecimalFormat, but the naive way for doing this would be > trying to use Float.parseFloat(string) that AFAIK uses the current Locale to do > it's thing, and catch any NumberFormatExceptions that arise...
This does not work because there are substrings of valid floats that don't successfully parse, e.g. "-", or ".".

I said it was naive, didn't I ? :)
I'll try to come up with something better, as this is a major no go for me...

(In reply to comment #6) > Sorry I probably wasn't fully awake when I looked at this. The problem is how > do we get something like a regexp, or even a list of valid characters for a > data type like float in a way that works with i10n? Does anybody know more > about DecimalFormat.toLocalizedPattern() and if it could be used for this > purpose? >
Are you saying that you don't think the format symbols defined for DecimalFormat will support our needs?
I'll take a look into this. I really want to see this done for 1.0.

We have a few issues here... 1. We're not localizing the display of integers, floats, or doubles by default. 2. We're not partiallly validating any of the above types by default.
#1 should be able to use the com.ibm.icu.text.DecimalFormat for formatting and parsing of the value in the default converter. We would assume the current locale by default and if any customization is necessary the consumer would have to write their own converter. Also since DecimalFormat is a part of the replacement plugin this wouldn't have much of an impact on consumers.
#2 is trickier. We can retrieve the format symbols from DecimalFormatSymbols. It provides API to retrieve the grouping separator, decimal separator, etc. and would allow us to cover the case of "-", ".", etc. But the current design of partial validation is going to make this difficult and costly. The value received by the partial validator is what the full value will be rather than what was just entered. We'd have to parse the value and if that fails we'd have to check for combinations of any of the format symbols on every key stroke. We can't rely upon java.util.regex for this as it is not part of the CDC 1.0 foundation. We'd either have to roll our own or include a third party library. If the partial validator was passed only what changed we'd be able to partially validate this but this is not the case today. Dave or Boris if you have any input on why this was written this way I'd appreciate knowing. My guess is that this was meant to be an abstraction for masking. My feelings are that since we're losing the context of the change this could become costly. If we were to validate each character of the value in order to do this properly we'd have to add a dependency on the full version of com.ibm.icu.text and disallow the replacement plugin option. The reason being that in JSE 1.4.x Character.isDigit(char) doesn't take into account supplementary characters[1]. This is a part of ICU4J and also Java 5. There might be a way to not require this if building against a 1.5 JDK but I'd have to do some digging.
I'm going to look into this more this week but needed to get my thoughts out.
[1] http://java.sun.com/developer/technicalArticles/Intl/Supplementary/

I'm working on converting the converters to use ICU4J and that's going fine. But the "partial validation" is making me pretty uneasy. As a result I'm thinking about removing it... or I guess not adding it back. Bear with me...
Partial validation was meant as an abstraction for masking Text widgets. I don't know of a use case other than Text and if someone has one I'd like to hear it. But partial validation abstracts so much that it's going to be costly in regards to performance. Most masking implementations that I've written or seen convey the value being added and it's position. This allows for fine grained processing which intelligent masking requires. By providing an abstraction we're forcing the validator to unravel the diff to determine what was entered and where in was entered.
So my opinion at this point in time is that we should remove partial validation but provide API to expose what is necessary for a consumer to implement intelligent masking. We would need to provide examples of this as it will be a common request so that with minimal effort the consumer could get up and running with it.
Comments? This might be a good topic to discuss at EclipseCon in the presence of beer. ;)

>..but provide API to expose what is necessary for a consumer to implement >intelligent masking. We would need to provide examples of this as it will be a >common request so that with minimal effort the consumer could get up and >running with it.
As a consumer I would like to see data binding simplify the chore of validating what goes into the widget from SWT. Intelligent masking would be very nice.
At Eclipsecon 2007 BOF we saw a great presentation. I asked about using databinding to filter the allowed keys. My example was a US Zip code. It should be 5 numeric characters. My question was " could non numeric characters be ignored.
An example program was modified to uppercase and then only vowels for the name. This was cool and impressive but there were two problems. One was identified immediately by the developers. The "aeiou" was translated to "AEIOU" in the field in the table but not in the widget in which it was being typed.
The second problem, to my mind, was that when the first non-vowel was entered the field was invalid. How does the user simply fix it? As the programmer I would like to simple ignore characters which don't fit the rules. If this were typed
aeIoYU
I want to see in the widget to which I am entering the data.
AEIOU
The lower case keys uppercased the the "Y" simply dropped.
I like the idea of using regular expressions and encourage the team to put them back in.
This history shows how regular expressions don't work well for numbers. I suggest that something else supplement, or be used in place of, regular expressions. It seems that text representing numbers is not well suited to be evaluated as regular expressions but they do have some fairly simple rules.
digits only except - none or one decimal delimiter dependent on the nl - none, one or many thousands delimited depending on the nl - none or one negative sign at the beginning or end of the string (nl dependent)
It seems that this would work for simple data types (int, float, etc) and BigDecimal. Please don't forget BigDecimal (and I suppose the other Bigs).
I think that there is a difference between a number and text which contains numbers. I may be wrong but I don't see that there is really much intellegent masking, except for range perhaps, for true numbers.
For example, a "telephone number" is not a numeric value. You dont add it or manipulat it as a number. It is simply text which is formatted by rules.
Things that are true numbers don't have much formatting and simple validation. Counts, amounts, measurements, etc. The validation that they do have isn't done well by regex. Why not treat them differently?
In summary I want to see from databinding (or maybe parly from SWT) - intellegent masking - basic keystroke validation - option to use regular expression for keystroke validation - choice to simply ignore keystrokes which are valid as user enters them - option to use regular expressions to validate field - testing / editing text with is going into a primitive or BigXXXXX with rules appropriate to the numeric data in place of regular expressions.
If databinding can't provide all of this, then I would like to see hooks to do it myself and plenty of examples how.
Thanks you all very much. Great work.
I have some code locally but it's not worth publishing at this point. I'm adding the "helpwanted" keyword as I won't be getting back to this soon.

Removing blocking of bug 154132 (plan item).
Also I'm rewording the summary as partial validation has been removed from the binding pipleine and this request is now for examples of how to perform partial validation. The i18n issues mentioned in comment 2 are being handled by our default converters and validators. If not please open a new bug with details of the issue.

This was due to an NullPointerException that occured because there was no wizard page for referenced projects available.
verified long ago: closing this bug

bug.short_desc: [Workbench] No possibility to update the value of "fIsEmpty" field of ElementTreeSelectionDialog

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: I20061102-1715
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create an ElementTreeSelectionDialog. 2. Assign a non-Null but empty semantic model as input. 3. Semantically add a element to the semantic model. 4. Then the dialog will show the semantic element but you won't be able to select it and hit OK.
More information: The private boolean field "fIsEmpty" is set only in the open(). But it must be possible to somehow update its value (the OK status respectively) upon modifications of the semantic model.
Proposal 1: Change updateOKStatus() to explicitly look for model changes.
Proposal 2: Declare fIsEmpty as *protected* boolean fIsEmpty.

bug.short_desc: Variable names in variables view missing

long_desc.thetext:
I20061219-1300
1. Create a new Java Project 'JUnit' 2. Import 'junit3.8.1src.zip' 3. Set a breakpoint on first line of 'junit.samples.VectorTest.setUp()' 4. Debug 'VectorTest' as 'Java Application' 5. When the breakpoint is hit step after creation of 'fFull' 6. Expand 'fFull' in the variable view 7. 'Resume' Is: Variable view shows tree without variable names (see screen shot)
Created an attachment (id=56626) screen shot
Does this happen every time? I have not been able to reproduce.

No, not every time, but very often (maybe 95%). And not all names are missing all the time. It seams, that the tree is not redrawn when the breakpoint is hit (the tree shows part of the old content). Pressing 'Step Over' after the breakpoint is hit does redraw the tree. This is in I20070109-1805

We've made many fixes around this lately. Cannot reproduce - marking as dup of related bug 173898.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 173898 ***

bug.short_desc: PHP Executable definitions not persisted in 0.7RC1

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Launch PHP IDE (no EXEs defined) 2. Open preferences, Expand PHP, Select PHP Executables 3. Add a valid entry 4. Press OK to close the preferences box (do not go to any other PHP references page) 5. shutdown PHP IDE and restart 6. Open preferences, Expand PHP, Select PHP Executables The entry has not been persisted
More information: It looks like PHPDebugPlugin.getDefault().savePluginPreferences(); is not being called when only adding PHP Executables. It does get called which then saves the EXE definitions if you go to other PHP preference pages.
Fixed. Added a call to save the plugin preferences
closing this bug after verifing the fix

bug.short_desc: [model] code assist favorites must honour build path of project in context

long_desc.thetext:
I can reproduce the problem only if Stat.java is opened in a editor. When the editor is closed 'testMethod' isn't proposed.
The problem seems to be in NameLookup. The workingcopies given to build the NameLookup aren't filtered if they are not on the buildpath of the project.
I can reproduce a similar behavior with the following test case.
1) create a project P1 2) create p1/X.java inside P1 package p1; public class X {}
3) create a project P2 4) create p2/Y.java inside P2 package p2; import p1| // complete at | location public class Y { } 5) do ctrl+space at | location
if X.java is opened in an editor p1 is proposed. if X.java isn't opened in an editor p1 isn't proposed.
*** Bug 170249 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
NameLookup constructor should filter out working copies that don't belong to the project
See also bug 194399
Created an attachment (id=75957) Proposed fix and regression test
Fix and test released for 3.4M2 in HEAD.
Verified for 3.4 M2 using I20070917-0010.

bug.short_desc: The build should include the examples source plugin

long_desc.thetext:
In the past we've chosen not to release the examples source plugin because we were concerned that people would rely on them for actual development.
Today the Eclipse community is way more aware of the project's organization and the meaning of the types of files produced by a build. So it may be a good moment to revisit the initial decision and enhance the user's experience by providing a source plugin for the examples.
The changes are committed to CVS.

bug.short_desc: org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.prefs does not get updated with current list of logs if log/s deleted from Log Navigator view.

long_desc.thetext:
Build: TPTP 4.4 (tptp.runtime-TPTP-4.4.0-200612051013.zip)
org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.prefs does not get updated with current list of logs if log/s deleted from Log Navigator view.
Import any 2 logs Open .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings\org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.prefs file. Verify that those two logs are added as a LogFileElement in it.
Remove any one log. Verify that LogFileElement for last deleted log is removed from the above pref file.
org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.prefs does not get updated.
updated cc list

The purpose of that preference is to provide log set information for the user to quickly import logs and it was not designed to stay in synch with the content of the log navigator. I can delete a log file but the information used to import that log file are still in the log set as long as the user doesn't choose to remove them. This is in this view not a defect. If you need information related to each log in the workspace you would need to load all the log sets, then go through each log file in the workspace and identify the corresponding log element in the log sets. I would rather say this is a feature request.
OK. I though this was a problem, but I guess this work as design. Closing this bug.
Closed

bug.short_desc: [misc] Usability bug: no way to leave editor with unsaved contents after file is deleted from disk

long_desc.thetext:
When there's an opened file and user deletes the file from disk Eclipse offers two options: save file or close without saving. There are two problems with it: - when query window opens there's no way to go back to an editor with unsaved contents e.g. for copying/pasting contents to another file or saving at a later time - closing query window closes editor without further questions. I believe either this dialog should be impossible to close this way or default behavior should be to leave editor untouched.
There is a workaround but I believe many people may not be aware of it: close file without saving and go to Restore From Local History for copying contents. But this is an obviously suboptimal solution.
Build ID: I20061214-1445
Dani, I believe this dialog is owned by Platform/Text, isn't it?

Agree that it is a bit hard to get back to the state where the user started to edit the file in Eclipse. However, if we just allow to go back to the dirty editor it might be strange for the user to get a Sava As... dialog later (since the underlying file is gone).
The dialog could offer to restore the file and continue editing in one step.

More information:

The '-' is a separator between repository url and the task id, but still, it is unclear, why dash in the id itself is prohibited. Mik, do you have anything to say in your defence?

The dash was chosen as a separator for handles before JIRA was on the table. There are ways around this, e.g. encoding the dash as another character, or hashing the key to an int. This will be addressed along with bug 170587 and bug 149624.
Alan: once bug 166174 is fixed, your request will be supported via the Open Repository Task dialog.

bug.short_desc: Incorrect detection of duplicate resources

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: 3.2.0.v20060603
Steps To Reproduce: We implemented a custom filesystem (WebDAV) plugin that supports project creation based on labels (comparable to CVS tags). To differentiate between a regular resource and the version of that resource bearing a certain label, we use a query in our URIs. For example: "webdav://example.com/dir/file.ext" representing the most recent version (HEAD) and "webdav://example.com/dir/file.ext?label=production" representing an older version of the same resource.
In Eclipse, however, when checking out a project "dir" with the HEAD version and a project "dir (production)" with the labeled version, both projects are considered aliases by org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.AliasManager because they share the same URI, except for the query part.
As a result, when modifying one project (eg adding a new resource), this modification is also performed in the labeled project. This leads to errors in subsequent operations as the resource displayed by Eclipse in the erroneously aliased project does not really exist.
One possible solution is to include the query part in the comparator in the same class.
More information:

Created an attachment (id=56629) Possible fix
Patch against org.eclipse.core.internal.resources R3_2_maintenance, modifying the comparator to include the URI query part.
I really didn't know how to compute ordering of URIs containing a query component. Your suggested fix seems reasonable. I will release it into HEAD to see how it plays out.

Thank you for your quick response.
I agree that comparing queries is pretty arbitrary. The most important aspect, though, is that URIs bearing queries are not considered equal if those queries are different.

Created an attachment (id=56709) Functionally identical fix with some code formatting/cleanup
This fix is against HEAD
Is that patch correct? It looks like you selected the org.eclipse.core.jobs project instead of the org.eclipse.core.resources right underneath.

Created an attachment (id=56711) Corrected patch
I don't know how that happened - it was certainly the wrong patch.
Patch released. Thanks for your contribution. This is fairly complex code and it must have been a challenge to track down.

attachment.desc: Functionally identical fix with some code formatting/cleanup

bug.short_desc: Only plug-in name in editor history

long_desc.thetext:
3.3 M4
Open the PDE editor on a plugin.xml file (e.g. org.eclipse.jdt.ui/plugin.xml). Open other editors and then look at the editor history (drop down of the arrow in the tool bar).
Observe: there is an entry 'org.eclipse.jdt.ui' which looks a bit strange. All other editors list the file name. Maybe it should read Plug-in 'org.eclipse.jdt.ui' to make it more obvious that this isn't a file.

The editor history is keying off the title of the editor. PDE currently displays the Bundle-SymbolicName or the Bundle-Name of the plug-in (depends on a PDE preference). You are right this does not fit with other editors in Eclipse, most others do use file name.
There are a couple reasons I believe this should not be changed. First, is the terminology. We are getting more developers from all over (OSGi and Eclipse) and some know the editor as the Plug-in Editor and others as the Bundle Editor. The same editor is used when creating an OSGi bundle project. If we labeled the editor with "Plug-in" it would confuse OSGi developers (and vice versa for Eclipse developers).
Second, what should be done when the user chooses to display presentation names instead of ids? The title of the editor then becomes the Bundle-Name instead of the Bundle-SymbolicName. In the editor history, this also appears strange. I personally think it is nice to see the name as the title of the editor when the user sets this preference. If we try to make the id title not look so weird, what should be done when the presentation name is the title of the editor?
If you disagree, we can definitely discuss it and reopen the bug.

bug.short_desc: [CheatSheet] Allow open cheat sheet from a URL

long_desc.thetext: Enhancement request to allow a cheat sheet to be opened by supplying a URL in the cheat sheet selection dialog.

Here's more details on how I think this would best work. There are two issues to consider:
1. What is the UI to open a cheatsheet from a URL? 2. How do we prevent problems where an action or command launched from a cheat sheet either fails to execute or executes incorrectly because it there is a version or configuration mismatch between the cheatsheet and the Eclipse platform or Eclipse based product?
The simplest way to implement the UI would be to add another radio button to the cheat sheet selection dialog to allow for a URL to be entered. The user would typically paste the URL into the text box. Allowing a cheatsheet to be opened from a hyperlink in the Browser widget would be interesting but I'm not sure that I understand the implications well enough to want to do this.
As for preventing problems due to commands and actions not matching the Eclipse version I think that for this release we should simply not allow commands or actions to be launched from a cheat sheet if the cheat sheet was opened by selecting the "Open from URL" option in the cheat sheet selection dialog. While this greatly restricts what a cheat sheet opened from the internet can do it also makes them safer. For a future release we can revisit how to ensure that a cheat sheet is compatible with the Eclipse version it is running in.

I would hope that when it comes down to the end user, they would almost always have some link or button that would lead them into the cheat sheet. For example, you could have a command link (e.g. "Show me how") in a help topic that opens a specific cheat sheet. So I think a command to open a cheat sheet like this is important (if not already available).
The manual type-in is still needed though for cases like when they're viewing Web pages in their browser (i.e. copy and paste URL).
I think having the radio button in the open cheatsheet dialog is fine, and I agree with turning off actions for now (i.e. replace actions with a "click to complete").

RE: (1)
I think having a third radio button would be fine. My first thought was to reuse the second radio button for opening a cheat sheet from a file; but, the browse button would not make any sense in that context. For the UI, I suggest emulating the Firefox / IE address bar by having an editable drop menu that remembers recently entered URLs and an associated open button:
+--------------------------+---+ +---------+ | http://www.eclipse.... | V | | OPEN | +--------------------------+---+ +---------+
RE: (2)
I agree with both you and Curtis regarding the disablement of the commands / actions.
This feature is now implemented. A warning dialog will be shown for a cheat sheet opened from the selection dialog using a URL if that cheat sheet contains commands or actions.
Fixed for 3.3 M5

Hi,
I just had a query regarding this ... it looks great, since I'm planning on doing some more work with cheat sheets - in particular the ability to get them from "elsewhere" - that is, from locations different from the local file system.
As such, I wondered whether the use of the Eclipse File System (EFS) API was considered for this functionality? It seems like a great fit.
From what I can tell from the code (not being an expert) it looks like the 3.3 drop simply does an openStream on the URL.
cheers, Evan
Yes we just added some UI to allow access to the already existing methods tp open from a URL reference. I didn't consider using EFS, would that give us additional benefits?

Hi,
I think that it would provide benefits in general - and in particular for my case :-) I'm working on being able to hook up a database as the backend for my File system. Obviously, I'm happy to help in whatever way I can.
EFS basically provides a virtual layer for interfacing to any storage facility via a simple "File like" interface.
For some more details on EFS - the wiki is here: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/EFS
There have also been some great articles on the Eclipsezone site. See these for more info:
- http://eclipsezone.com/eclipse/forums/t83786.rhtml - http://www.eclipsezone.com/articles/efs/
One downside, at the moment however, is that there isn't an official Eclipse implementation of EFS which is backed by http.
The wiki enumerates some of the current known implementations - and there is an Http one by Cape Clear. So there would be some work required here.
Another small issue to resolve would be how the presence of alternate file systems is surfaced to the user (if at all). I'm told that there is some work in this area for the import wizards.
I'm guessing that this is a little late for the 3.3 release in any case, but it would be a "good thing" to aim for I think.
cheers, Evan

Hi again,
I've just had another thought ... it may not be as difficult as I thought to provide a combined approach. I envisage perhaps a two phase situation:
1. for now, process the URI (if selected), and if the scheme is http, then use existing code, otherwise - attempt to use the EFS to process the URL.
2. when Eclipse has access to a http EFS provider, then simply use EFS to process all URIs which are entered.
again - just a random thought.
cheers, Evan

bug.short_desc: Submitting changes to bugzilla issue leads to "failed to submit to repository" dialog, but issue has been saved (except for "Attach Context")

Build ID: M20060629-1905
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Add a comment to an issue 2. Press submit to repository 3. Dialog "Failed to submit to repository" appears
More information: Bugzilla is an internal installation with very fast response times. (Not very much entries in there, since we evaluating still). Nearly no customizings applied to bugzilla (only CSS styles), we use version 2.22.1)
Actually the changes are saved successfully (see screenshot I will attach), except in case you check the "Attach Context" checkbox. The context will not be attached, and the bugzilla result of this indicates that "nothing" has been changed (see screenshot). In case of other changes they are saved successfully, but it seems mylar "thinks" thats not the case. After synchronizing and discarding local changes everything looks fine again. (Since the changes were saved the synchronization just updates with the correct data). The web-page which is shown in the error dialog is just the "normal" "successful saved" web-page from bugzilla, no error page.

Created an attachment (id=56634) Screenshot showing the "Failed to submit to repository" dialog.
Screenshot showing the "Failed to submit to repository" dialog, after checking the "attach context" checkbox and submitting the issue.

We have to parse the response html to confirm a successful submit. Our code was searching for "Bug processed", yours reads "Issue processed". This is the likely reason for this failure and it has been recently address. The next release includes this fix as does the currently available developer build (3.3M4 only) at download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev.
