bug.short_desc: Need ability to build without resolution

long_desc.thetext:
In the Orbit project, our (initial) goal is to "build" third party code that resides in cvs, using the "normal" PDE build process. It is, though, just binary class files, so the "build" is more of a copy and compose and package type operation, rather than a compile, per se.
We would have, for example, just one or two "build-time features" where we would spec what should be built, but these would be pretty much arbitrary lists of bundles. The idea was to have one feature that would contain the initial versions of a bundle (such as org.junit 3.8.1) but then another feature that would contain subsequesnt version (such as org.junit 4.1.0).
But, this has turned out harder than I thought. For example, the jasper bundle "pre-reqs" some bundles, such as servlets 2.4, and jsp 2.0 ... so, care needs to be taken to make sure all the required bundles are in the same build feature, or else an "unresolved dependancies" error will stop the build, during the generate script phase.
While for small lists of bundles, this can be "hacked around" by carefully tweaking the feature lists, this does not seem scalable, since would quickly get pretty complex, some bundles being required in several features, for example.
And, they are not _really_ required, since we are not compiling.
In orbit, we could live with no resolution for the whole build or whole feature build, but seems ideally a plugin/bundle could spec in it's build.properties that resolving pre-req errors could be ignored for that one bundle, that the pre-reqs were not really needed during this "copy and compose" build ... or, perhaps a flag to say it was a "binary bundle", no compile would be taking place.
In otherwords, some sort of flag or simplication will be needed for large scale projects like orbit (but might be nice even for a few isolated cases during normal builds).
*** Bug 60004 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I meant to mark it as dup

bug.short_desc: problem sending parameters to PostgreSQL procedure

long_desc.thetext: When creating the rptdesign report, with the data below, occurred an error when requesting the visualization of the SQL instruction. It seemed me that he is not being able to deal with the function parameters. I'm using the postgresql-8.1-407.jdbc3.jar plugin to have access to PostgreSQL with BIRT.

(In reply to comment #0) > When creating the rptdesign report, with the data below, occurred an error when > requesting the visualization of the SQL instruction. > It seemed me that he is not being able to deal with the function parameters. > I'm using the postgresql-8.1-407.jdbc3.jar plugin to have access to > PostgreSQL with BIRT. > 1. DATA SET Data Set Type: SQL Select Query
2. PARAMETERS Name Data Type Direction Default Value 1 dtCorrente1 Any Input '23/12/2006' 2 dtCorrente2 Any Input '23/12/2006' ...
3. QUERY SELECT CASE WHEN {d ?} > ap.vencimento THEN ap.valor + ( ( ac.valor * ( 100 / ap.valor ) ) * ( {call aplica_multa( acne.numeracao,acne.exercicio::int,acne.cod_parcela, {d ?} )} ) / 100 ) ELSE ap.valor END::numeric(14,6) AS valor_total,
...
FROM arrecadacao.cadastro_economico_faturamento AS acef
...
4. PREVIEW RESULTS
Expected result: to return registers for query
Actual result: A BIRT exception occurred. Plug-in Provider:Eclipse.org Plug-in Name:BIRT Data Engine Plug-in ID:org.eclipse.birt.data Version:2.1.0.N20060628-1351 Error Code:odaconsumer.CannotExecuteStatement Error Message:Cannot execute the statement. SQL statement does not return a ResultSet object. SQL error #1: ERROR: syntax error in or near to "$1"

This is a know issue and the problem has been resolved in latest BIRT. Please update to latest stable version of BIRT.
Thanks. Lin

I have updated to version 2.1.1, but had a new problem: "/" used as a division symbol are been seen as a comment. This is already solved in another bug of version 2.2.0, but in this version the first problem is back.

hi Marson,
Sorry maybe I miss the point. Do you mean in BIRT 2.2.0 the "/" in sql statement leads to sql exception?
Thanks. Lin

hi, ok ... let us see for topic 1) BIRT, in 2.1.0 version, don't recognize de PostgreSQL's procedures/functions; 2) BIRT, in 2.1.1 version, says that the "/" is a commentary signal and not a division signal. 3) In another bug, here in eclipse bugs, this problem, with "/", its solved, updating to 2.2.0 version but the problem in first topic (with procedures/functions) is back ...
I hope to have me done to understand, now.
Thanks. Mrson

Hi,
Sorry for not replying you in time due to the internet outrange caused be recently earthquake.
So The problem now is in BIRT 2.2 the postgress function parameter does not work. We will investigate this.
Thanks. Lin

Hi Marson, The issue 'ERROR: syntax error in or near to "$1"' might be caused by the error writing of your sql text. From my understanding, you could try: SELECT CASE WHEN to_date{?,''DD/MM/YYYY''} > ap.vencimento THEN ap.valor + ( ( ac.valor * ( 100 / ap.valor ) ) * ( {call aplica_multa( acne.numeracao,acne.exercicio::int,acne.cod_parcela, to_date(?,'DD/MM/YYYY') )} ) / 100 ) ELSE ap.valor END::numeric(14,6) AS valor_total,
...
FROM arrecadacao.cadastro_economico_faturamento AS acef
I think this should be acceptable for postgreSQL.

Hi, Have you try the statment I suggested? I think it should work, so I will close this bug. If there's still any problem, please reopen and commonds on it.
Thanks Mingxia

bug.short_desc: Wrong warning "The field class.field is never read locally" for finalizer guardian

long_desc.thetext: Indeed in this code sample, field 'finalizerGuardian' is written, but it is never read. The warning looks correct to me.

bug.short_desc: Better location for deprecated type warning message

long_desc.thetext:
This is a duplicate of bug 132677 which originally only asked to improve the deprecation problem range and then got generalized.
I would like to see this (the deprecation case) fixed because we could then go ahead and improve Javadoc hovers: currently we show the problem message for deprecated code. Unfortunately the problem text isn't a big help i.e. doesn't tell you what to do. I would like to show the Javadoc of the deprecated element in this case. This is currently hard because the problem range is too big. If the range would be reduced to the name range (so that it matches codeSelect behavior) I could make this happen.
See also bug 36754.

bug.short_desc: Remove unused plugin dependencies

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20061129-0800
Steps To Reproduce: This easy procedure will certainly improve performance when loading the Web service plugins.
1. For each Plugin, open the manifest editor to the dependencies page. 2. Run "Find unused dependencies". 3. Allow the dialog to remove the unused dependencies.
More information:

Seng, I have consistently found the PDE to be overzealous when it identifies and removes what it thinks are unused plugin dependencies. I have tried this procedure a few times in the past, and on every occasion the PDE has removed dependencies that are in fact needed (indirectly required plugins, for example). If you can identify specific unnecessary plugin dependencies, please resubmit this bug and identify them. A general sweep has not panned out on past attempts.
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.

bug.short_desc: [CellEditors] TableViewer doesn't activate TextCellEditor consistently

long_desc.thetext: A TextCellEditor is not activated consistently in a TableViewer if the cell clicked is not in the currently selected row. Running the sample application in a debugger, the bounds reported for the table item appears to be incorrect for the column when the row is not selected. This behaviour can be observed by setting a breakpoint at TableEditorImpl.java line 135 (the if statement doesn't return true unless the row is selected due to the bounds being incorrect): if (bounds.contains(event.x, event.y)) {
Created an attachment (id=56646) sample SWT application attached.
David, I can't use the zip as given due to pathing issues but try creating the table with the 'SWT.FULL_SELECTION' style and let me know if that fixes things...thanks

Yes, SWT.FULL_SELECTION appears to fix this issue.
If the solution is to set the SWT.FULL_SELECTION style bit, then the javadocs should note that the bit must be set for cell editors to work correctly.

Good point, where would you have expected to find this tidbit?
Boris/Tom, I'm not sure where the correct location(s) to place this info but we should add it, I've seen at least one other person run into the same problem (which is how I could address David's problem so quickly...;-).
How about in the org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table class javadocs? That seems to be where it explains how to use other style bits.

Yes, something like
"Note that for Trees and Tables this bit is necessary to allow selections in any but the furst column."
Except for the typo...;-)

bug.short_desc: Update Configurator reconciles platform.xml with newer features even for sites that have USER-INCLUDE Policy and have explicit inclusion plugin lists

long_desc.thetext: A twin of bug 166852 that has been fixed in 3.2.2.
We failed to release this patch to 3.3. It is a low-risk fix that has already been used in 3.2.2 for a while.
I will release this one into RC4 without reviews because the fix has already been released into a GA stream (3.2.2) and no problems from the 3.2.2 users have been reported.
